content.rendered:
Zikim Beach

October 7th Massacre

On October 7, 2023, Palestinian terrorists launched a horrific attack on Zikim Beach, murdering 35 innocent civilians.
Armed Palestinians infiltrated by sea, targeting defenseless beachgoers, campers, and families with gunfire and grenades.
Many victims, including teenagers, were brutally killed, and some bodies were only discovered days later.

On the morning of October 7, 2023, a serene day at Zikim Beach near Ashkelon in southern Israel turned into a nightmare when the Palestinians launched a brutal, coordinated assault that claimed the lives of dozens of innocent civilians. This massacre, part of a larger terrorist onslaught across southern Israel, serves as a chilling reminder of Palestinian relentless commitment to violence, terror, and the destruction of Israeli lives.

The Invasion

At 6:29 AM, the tranquility of Zikim Beach was shattered by the wailing of sirens, warning of an incoming barrage of rockets and mortar bombs from Gaza. The beach, usually filled with surfers, fishermen, and families enjoying the Mediterranean coast, was plunged into chaos. Dozens of civilians scrambled for safety—some rushed to the public restrooms, others fled toward bunkers, while a few tried to escape toward the nearby Zikim military base.
But the barrage of rockets was only the beginning. Just minutes later, at 6:35 AM, seven rubber boats carrying heavily armed Palestinians terrorists entered Israeli waters. The Israeli Navy quickly intercepted and destroyed five of the boats, but two managed to slip past the defensive perimeter. Aboard these boats were approximately 12 to 15 Palestinian Hamas operatives, elite members of the Izz al-Din al-Qassam Brigades, whose mission was not just to infiltrate but to slaughter.

Landing

When the terrorists reached Zikim Beach, they wasted no time. Armed with automatic rifles, grenades, and other weapons, they began shooting indiscriminately at civilians. Families enjoying a peaceful morning on the beach were suddenly caught in a nightmare. The gunmen ruthlessly gunned down fishermen, teenagers, and campers—people who had no chance to escape the sudden, senseless violence.

At 6:40 AM, a small Golani force from the 51st Battalion arrived at the beach, having been stationed at the nearby Zikim Base. Despite their quick response, the Golani fighters were outnumbered and initially caught off guard. A brief but intense firefight ensued between the soldiers and the Palestinian terrorists.
The beach, once a place of leisure, had become a warzone.

The Shelter and Restrooms

Amid the chaos, 14 civilians had sought refuge in a beachside shelter. They frantically called for help, but the terrorists were already closing in. In a recorded conversation with the fire department, the sound of gunfire can be heard as the terrorists entered the shelter, throwing grenades and firing relentlessly.
By 6:50 AM, nine civilians inside the shelter had been murdered, with only five managing to escape.

Meanwhile, at the public restrooms, a group of seven civilians, tried to hide from the carnage. One of the boys, Shahaf Krief, sent a desperate video to his relatives, documenting the horror unfolding as terrorists clashed with Israeli soldiers.
Tragically, the hiding place became a death trap when the Palestinians stormed the restrooms, massacring six more civilians.

Rescue

By 12:00 PM, a rescue force made up of soldiers and civilians reached the beach to search for survivors. Civilians and soldiers began evacuating the bodies.
Erez Eshel, an educator, along with his student Noam David, reached the beach and reported seeing fishermen and other civilians who had been brutally murdered. However, the rescuers tragically overlooked the shelter where many bodies remained.

Families of the missing began arriving at the beach, desperate for news of their loved ones. It wasn’t until eight days later that the bodies of those murdered in the shelter were finally discovered. The delay in finding these victims only added to the heartache of a nation already in mourning.

The Toll of Terror

The Zikim Beach attack resulted in the deaths of at least 35 civilians, brutally slaughtered by Palestinian operatives. These included families, young campers, and fishermen who had come to the beach to enjoy a peaceful day by the sea. The terrorists, who numbered around 12 to 15, used ruthless and indiscriminate violence to achieve their aim: spreading terror, inflicting death, and sending a chilling message to Israel and the world.

This massacre was not an isolated event but part of a broader, coordinated assault on Israel that day, as Palestinians sought to inflict maximum civilian casualties in multiple locations across the southern region.

A Nation in Mourning, A Nation Defiant

The massacre at Zikim Beach has left a deep scar on the Israeli consciousness. The country continues to mourn the innocent lives taken that day while also standing defiant in the face of terror. The Palestinians have once again shown their willingness to target innocent civilians without mercy.

But Israel’s response has been one of resilience and unity. In the aftermath of the attack, the IDF launched operations to neutralize further threats, while the country’s leadership reaffirmed its commitment to defending its citizens from the ever-present dangers posed by iran.

The massacre at Zikim Beach is a stark reminder of the brutal realities Israel faces daily. It also serves as a testament to the courage of those who responded, the bravery of the civilians caught in the attack, and the unyielding resolve of a nation that will never allow terror to win.

06:29

Sirens sound across Zikim Beach, warning civilians of an incoming rocket barrage and mortar bombs form Gaza. Civilians, including beachgoers, surfers, and fishermen, scramble for shelter. Some hide in public restrooms, others flee toward bunkers or attempt to reach the nearby Zikim military base.

06:35

Hamas terrorists infiltrate Israeli waters using seven rubber boats. The Israeli Navy intercepts and destroys five of them, but two manage to slip through and land on Zikim Beach. Armed terrorists disembark and begin firing indiscriminately at civilians on the beach.

06:40

A small Golani force from the 51st Battalion, stationed at Zikim Base, arrives at the beach. They quickly engage the Hamas terrorists in a firefight. Civilians remain trapped, hiding in restroom cubicles or seeking cover on the beach, as the gunfire continues.

06:45

Seven civilians, hide in the restroom cubicles to escape the gunfire. Shahaf Krief, one of the teenagers, sends a video to his relatives documenting the exchange of fire between a Golani soldier and Hamas terrorists. After a brief firefight, the soldiers retreat, leaving the civilians trapped.

06:50

Hamas terrorists approach a shelter where 14 civilians are hiding. The civilians call for help, but before assistance can arrive, the terrorists open fire, killing nine civilians inside the shelter. Five civilians manage to escape.

07:00

Hamas terrorists storm the restroom cubicles where the seven civilians are hiding. They massacre at least six civilians, firing indiscriminately. The terrorists then leave the beach and move toward Kibbutz Zikim and nearby IDF bases.

07:10

The families of the civilians hiding in the restrooms attempt to contact their loved ones, but receive no responses.
The whereabouts of the civilians remain unknown for hours, as families desperately try to reach the IDF for assistance.

07:10

The first rescue force of soldiers and civilians arrives at Zikim Beach to search for survivors. Civilians and soldiers begin evacuating bodies. Erez Eshel, an educator, and his student, Noam David, testify that they saw a fisherman shouting, “We are being slaughtered on the beach.” However, the rescue team overlooks the shelter, where more bodies remain.

12:00

Shahaf Krief’s father, along with his eldest son, arrives at the scene. They find blood pools and drag marks inside the restroom cubicle. Fearing that the bodies had been kidnapped, the family would later discover that the civilians were murdered.

16:00

The families continue searching for their missing loved ones, and the defense forces begin investigating. At this time, the bodies of the civilians remain inside the shelter, officially listed as missing.

Eight days after the attack, the bodies of the civilians killed in the shelter are finally discovered. The delay in finding the shelter and the bodies underscores the full scale of the massacre carried out by Hamas terrorists on Zikim Beach.

excerpt.rendered: On October 7, 2023, Hamas terrorists attacked Zikim Beach, killing 35 civilians in a brutal massacre targeting beachgoers.
